is.merkor.core.database.data
Class LexicalRelation

java.lang.Object
  is.merkor.core.database.data.AbstractPersistentObject
      is.merkor.core.database.data.LexicalRelation
All Implemented Interfaces:
PersistentObject, Relation, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Relation>
public class LexicalRelation
extends AbstractPersistentObject
implements Relation, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Relation>

The class LexicalRelation maps to the table CONFIDENCE_LEXREL in the MerkOr database. A lexicalRelation consists of a WordPair and a LexicalRelationType. Every relation has a confidence value, a result of a computation based on all results of the automatic extraction of semantic information in MerkOr. Since this confidence value is dependent on how frequent the lexical items the relation connects are, another value, certainty tells how likely it is, that this relation is valid: 1=very likely, 2=whether likely nor unlikely 3=very unlikely.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Anna B. Nikulasdottir
See Also:

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this lexicalRelation. It is composed as follows:

"[" + this.getClass().getName() + leftLemma + relationTypeName + rightLemma + (confidence) + "]"

Overrides:
toString in class AbstractPersistentObject
Returns:
a string representation of this cluster

compareTo

public int compareTo(Relation relation)
Compares two relations. The comparison is based on the confidence attributes in descending order, with these being equal, the pair attributes are compared, and at last, with these being equal, the id attributes are compared.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface Relation
Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Relation>
Returns:
the value 0 if the argument relation is equal to this lexicalRelation; a value less than 0 if this lexicalRelation's confidence is GREATER than the argument's confidence, or, these being equal, if this lexcialRelation's pair is less than the argument's pair, or these being equal, if this lexicalRelation's id is less than the argument's id; and a value greater than 0 if this lexicalRelation's confidence is LESS than the argument's confidence, or, these being equal, if this lexicalRelation's pair is greater than the argument's pair, or these being equal, if this lexicalRelation's id is greater than the argument's id;

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Returns the hash code value for this lexicalRelation. The hash code of a lexicalRelation uses the hash code generator of HashCodeBuilder:

hashCode = new HashCodeBuilder().append(getId()).append(getPair()).append(getConfidence()).toHashCode())

Overrides:
hashCode in class AbstractPersistentObject
Returns:
the hash code value for this lexicalRelation
